explains: adj. 未受控制的，无管理的；未经调节的，未校准的

sentences.en: Finally, you have an unregulated market place, no government constraints, where prices could explode.
sentences.cn: 最后，你有一个不受监管的市场，没有政府的约束，价格可能会暴涨。

sentences.en: It is just that their relations are unregulated.
sentences.cn: 这正说明了他们的关系是不定的。

sentences.en: An unregulated, but subsidised, casino will not allocate resources well.
sentences.cn: 一个不受监管却接受补贴的赌场不会很好地配置资源。
